questions.question: An anonymous class cannot have an explicitly declared constructor.
Java final class can be a superclass.
Methods that are declared as final or static cannot be overridden.
Super class reference variables can always point to subclass objects.
In which data types the number 132 can fit?
The switch statement works with which of the following?
There can be only one public top-level class per .java file.
What is the output?
questions.description:
int[] arr = {0,0,0,0,0};
int x = 0;int y = 2;
for (int i = 0; i < 10; i +=2) {arr[x] = y + i;x++;}
System.out.print(arr[3]);

questions.question: What is the output?
questions.description:
int arr[]={1, 2, 3, 4, 5};int x = 4;int y = 0;
for(int i = 0; i < 5; i++)y += arr[x - i] * i;
System.out.print(y);

questions.question: What is the output?
questions.description: for (int i = 1, j = 10; i < j; i += i, i++)System.out.print(j - i);
